summary:
The Baltic states refer to Estonia, Latvia, and Lithuania, located on the Baltic Sea's eastern coast. These countries are part of several important international organizations, like NATO and the European Union. They are often called the "Baltic nations" and work closely together through intergovernmental and parliamentary cooperation.

The Baltic countries have strong economies and high standards of living. They collaborate on various issues, including defense, energy, and transportation, showcasing their unity and shared interests.
title: Baltic states
